author: Alberto Navarro
text: 'I really like this bar. Friendly
column5: not very loud. The beer selection is vast and in constant change. I have found excellent beers here. Good for meeting in the afternoon
column6: great for watching the games with friends.'

author: Regina Jaslow
text: 'Great beer selection!'

author: PH ST
text: 'This is the place for a fantastic selection of tap beers'

author: Eric Finkelstein
text: "Impressively deep selection of well-rated beers. I love that the drafts are all displayed cleanly and well-organized on a digital board that also displays the Beer Advocate rating. I'd prefer the Untappd rating
column5: but now I'm just being nitpicky.\nMy one genuine issue is the fact they don't serve flights or small pours (eg 4oz). But I'm otherwise so impressed that I still rate it 5 stars."

text: 'pro-segregation'

text: "Dog friendly bar with very kind staff members. Selection of beer is huge! Highly recommend! They don't have kitchen

author: David Holmes
text: 'Great pub! My wife and I stopped in and was pleasantly greeted and pleased to see the dividers up. Great selection of beers. They don‚Äôt really do mixed drinks as my wife wanted a margarita and they weren‚Äôt able to make it but she got a nice glass of wine instead.'

text: "This is my favorite bar in Hoboken! As a craft beer enthusiast
column5: I'm happy to have this place near by so that I can try a wide variety of beers that are local to NY and NJ."

author: Harrison Kanarick
text: 'Nice selection of beers and good amount of space to be able to socially distance.  They also had tvs to watch the NBA games which was nice.'

author: Jason Manenkoff
text: 'Best craft beer menue in Hoboken! It has improved 10 fold over the past 2 years and they‚Äôre now serving in proper glassware. Open late 3am on Sats and you can bring your dog! In addition no bathroom line as it‚Äôs not a singular bathroom.'

text: 'My favorite bar in Hoboken. Dog friendly'

author: Adrienne Doyle
text: 'Always an awesome selection of craft beer and an all around chill atmosphere. Dogs are welcome and you can bring in your own food or order seamless to the bar.'

author: Veronica Glennon
text: "Great corner pub in Hoboken
column5: highly recommend if you like beers and a more relaxed atmosphere for conversation. They also have cask ales which is a huge bonus if you're a fan of a typical London pub...its like a bit of the UK mixed with New York. Not a rowdy place
column6: but great for a few beers (or cider) with friends and it has a few dart boards too."

author: Robert Lurie
text: "Awesome little local draft bar. They have a rotating list of about 20 - 25 draft beers
column5: 5+ cask beers
column6: and a whole lot in cans and bottles. No food
column7: but the beer is great and reasonably priced. Can also fill up growlers if you have them.\n\nUpdate: 2 years later it's still just as good"

author: Melissa W.
text: 'OH man. THIS place. I missed Ireland dearly and wanted to go to an Irish pub. THIS place reminded me of home. They had my FAVOURITE Irish whiskey (Redbreast 12. Try it!) and had a large variety of beer. Luke and Keith were dears. DEFINITELY returning. üòä'

author: Ryan McEnerney
text: 'Great beer bar'

text: 'Great beer selection and I really liked having darts to play'

author: Gjergj Tr
text: 'Nice place to have a beer with friends in Hoboken!'

author: Kenneth Cardona
text: 'Large selection of beers
column5: darts and pups!'

author: Dan Ellsworth
text: "Terrific little DOG FRIENDLY dive bar with an excellent beer selection.  Can't speak highly enough.  Perfect winter hangout spot for beer loving dog owners.\n\nPlease note - no food available
column5: but apparently they're ok with you bringing in/ordering food to be delivered."

text: 'Love their beer selection and rating menu. Definitely one of our go-to places in Hoboken'

text: 'Excellent selection of craft beers. No food but you can order in or bring your own.'

text: 'Iam an driver for Hunterdon Brewie Co. I appreciate the warm welcoming while I deliver the #1 craft beer in the whole state of New Jersey!'

text: "One of the cleanest bathrooms I've ever seen in a bar.  Very cool concept.  I wasn't drinking and just got a Diet Coke (syrup was obviously old and/or expired
column5: which was the only issue).  Had a lot of fun here otherwise.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a good beer bar."

author: Erich Jost
text: "Best craft beer bar in Hoboken and NJ. They not only have the best beer selection around but it's also a great local hangout with a ton of TVs and darts in the back. You always feel like you're at home here."

text: 'Great number of taps. Suggest you get there early as it gets crowded. I would do away with darts during busy hours though'

author: Emma Grant
text: 'The world needs more pet friendly pubs and bars. If your dog likes socialising as much as you do
column5: this is the place! So many interesting beers on tap. They give you a bit of info about all the beers

author: Luke Vanderberg
text: 'Great local bar with a good beer selection.\nI‚Äôm a little biased since it‚Äôs my local bar. It‚Äôs half block from my apartment.\nUsually if someone mentions we should meet for a beer
column5: it‚Äôs the first place that comes to mind.\n\nIt doesn‚Äôt serve food
column6: but I‚Äôve brought my own before.\n\nIt also doesn‚Äôt have booths or chairs
column7: only high tops and the bar. It would be nice to have booths
column8: but what it lacks in tables in makes up for in dart boards.'

author: Joshua Inoa
text: 'The beer selection is great. Bring your dog place which makes me really happy'

author: Isabel
text: 'Favorite bar in Hoboken'

text: "Great beer selection. Small little place. When I went

column6: so it was good. I wonder how long it takes to get a beer when it's busy."

text: 'Best beer bar in town'

text: 'Great beer bar'

author: Charles Donaghue
text: 'Good place! Nice selection.'

text: 'Great beer selection with info about each beer

author: Tapan Desai
text: 'Nice little bar with amazing beer selection. The atmosphere is laid back and pretty chill. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Great place to hangout with friends.'

text: 'Great beer selection'

author: Erin Carrather
text: "One of my favorite spots. Doesn't hurt that it's up the block from my apartment. Awesome beer selection
column5: darts

author: Kerri Hadden
text: 'Love the selection of beers and the darts in the back but the one bartender is incredibly mean and miserable. When asked for a beer suggestion based on my preferences I was told "if that\'s what you like then you know better than me". And after asking for a water to accompany my beer I was given super side eye and attitude. Place would be much better without this downer.. so sad.'

author: Eugene Strupinsky
text: 'Great NJ beer selection.'

author: Lara Miller
text: 'Lots of craft beer. Most of it local. Has a rating of the beer on the menu. Dogs are welcome!'

author: Geoff Banker
text: 'Excellent dog-friendly spot for great beers and friendly bartenders.'

author: Charles Steffens
text: 'Amazing beer selection. Good atmosphere. Friendly staff.'

author: Thomas Kielich
text: 'Great laid-back beer bar in a town filled with watering holes for bros. No food served here so feel free to bring your own or just swing by for a seat at the bar or a game of darts\u200b. Also
column5: dogs are welcome!'

author: Chris Schubert
text: 'Best beer taps in NJ'

author: John Sama
text: 'Craft Beer and darts.  Bring your own food and you can bring your dog.'

author: Alex Biles
text: 'I come here quite often. They have a great beer selection.  It is pricey
column5: and they do not offer a happy hour
column6: however.  They do have TVs
column7: and I love playing darts there. You can bring food in

author: Ryan Shore
text: 'Great place to grab a drink.'

author: Brian Meise
text: "Great bar. They have a bunch of local bars on tap. You're allowed to bring your dog to the bar
column5: so there usually a couple of dogs there. If you like darts
column6: they have 3 dart boards."

author: Bryan Gardner
text: 'Great bar with great beers'

author: Shilpa Shree Gowda
text: 'Awesome beer list and pet friendly'

author: Joseph Andujar
text: 'Great place to chill great crowd great beer'

author: Mike Cowell
text: 'Wonderful beer selection.'

author: matt melachrinos
text: "Best beer selection in Hoboken. When the weather is nice they open the windows and there's nothing better than drinking craft beer and sitting at the window people watching."

author: Ryan Vassallo
text: 'Nothing beats Cork city if you enjoy your brews. If you dont love fine beers
column5: this is not the place for you. One of the only bars I know of that have casks tapped as well. The bsrtebders and the kwner are absolutely fantastic people and the general crowd is far superior to that of your typical Hoboken croud. No one is there to get smashed on a weekend
column6: everyone is there for a great time and some great beers.'

author: Stephen Napoles
text: 'Lots of good craft beer and tv.'

author: Brendan McDermott
text: "Cork City can't be beat.  Awesome beer selection which
column5: and it all moves quickly.  The bartenders are helpful.  Plus
column6: it's dog friendly.  Good job."

author: Serg C
text: 'Love that I could bring my dog here!'

author: Matthew Goczalk
text: 'An overwhelming beer selection. For someone like me
column5: I am paralyzed by choice often and this place fits the bill for that. Probably one of the larger beer selections in Hoboken.'

author: Stacey Olsewski
text: "great craft beer selection--every time there is something new. try a new sour rotating on tap or try a new brew on an evening of tap take overs. if you like beer
column5: you'll like it here."

author: Tom Zaki
text: 'Have you ever wanted to try over a hundred different beers in one night? Theoretically
column5: you could do that here! But seriously
column6: they have an amazingly large and always changing beer selection here. Awesome place to start a night out and try something new.'

author: Jon Florio
text: 'One of the best craft beer tap lists in all of Hoboken.'

author: Andrew Lloyd
text: 'Outstanding beer selection (from a beer snob). Bring your own food. Bring your dog. Great beer joint.'

author: Red Dacquel
text: "There's a lot to like about a legitimate craft beer bar in Hoboken- a spot that is chock full of sports bars but could really use more craft in their beverage line up. Cork is dog friendly
column5: has dart boards
column6: 41 rotating craft lines as well as 5 cask offerings... Boo yah. My new favorite spot."

author: Timothy Staub
text: 'Fantastic beer selection with a ton of rare beers and beer on cask!'

author: Dmitriy Schedov
text: 'Best variety of beers in this bank of Hudson. Atmosphere of old London pub. Nice place for pub lovers'

author: Yuriy Z
text: 'The frequent brewery tasting events make it a breeze top learn and try a wide variety of beers. Bartenders really know their beers
column5: and take the extra effort to drain the rare heady keg so you can always enjoy a cold brew.'

author: Greg Whipple
text: 'Good beer list. Always have the game on'

author: Michael Krupnick
text: 'Excellent Beer Selection and atmosphere for hanging with your buds....'

author: TOMAS HOFFMAN
text: "It's a great spot for a beer lover. Tons of Taos with a large variety. Also
column5: they have a very large bottle list."

author: JJ G
text: "You simply won't find a better craft beer selection in the area. Laid back atmosphere & great bar keeps only add to the awesome-ness. If I'm thirsty in Hoboken
column5: this is where you'll find me."

author: Greg Posner
text: 'Great bar
column5: great bartenders
column6: great beers'

author: Miguel Alc√≥n (Mikel)
text: 'Good selection of beers'

author: Heather Elyea
text: 'Great craft beer selection and friendly
column5: helpful staff.'

author: Zachary Rose
text: "Great selection of beers and friendly bartenders. Always every time I've been there but never so packed that you can't move or get a drink."

author: Christian Graninger
text: "Has nothing to do with cork city
column5: it's just the name and bar staff isn't very friendly"

author: Andy Lee
text: 'I went to Cork City with a close friend last Friday
column5: and the selection of beers they had was phenomenal.  They had their cellar raid earlier that week
column6: had had plenty of top beers left.  I was able to try my first mead here
column7: and even found a 2011 version of the Japanese Green Tea IPA!  Bartenders were very helpful

author: John Voorhees
text: 'Great beers.\nTerrible Staff.'

author: John Voorhees
text: 'Cork City has some of the best beer selection I have ever had. However their service staff is terrible.\nLast night I went in with some friends. My friends were served
column5: the waitress (I use the term waitress because this person broke all kinds of etiquette and I refuse to refer to her as a bartender) tells me she will be right with me. I then watch her go and serve 6 other people
column6: then get my friends their second round of drinks. After 15 minutes of standing at the bar I finally flag down the other bar tender. As the waitress sees the bar tender getting my drinks she rushes over and asks what she can get for me
column7: I politely tell her that I am already being helped. The night goes on and we have a few more drinks. I close out my tab while my friends are still drinking. I sign the reciept and leave it on the counter. The waitress insists that I fill in the total. I write down the total
column8: planning to leave a cash tip before we leave. As soon as I set down the check she picks it up and asks if there was a problem with the service. I inform her that I was dissatisfied with the wait
column9: at which point she launches into a tirade about how she only makes 2.16 an hour
column10: how I should feel ashamed for not leaving a tip
column11: how it would be cheaper for me to go home and drink a 6-pack alone
column12: and how much she kicks ass at her job. Never before have I been treated so rudely or encountered such a strong sense of entitlement from service staff that they would think it is acceptable to berate a customer. Honestly
column13: it was embarrassing and childish behavior that I am appalled to believe Cork City would condone.\nIn summation
column14: while Cork City has great beer
column15: their employees need to learn proper manners.'

author: Patrick Brose
text: "The bar has a ton of beers on tap and an obscene number in bottles. Lots of obscure craft beers to be had. Nice atmosphere
column5: not too loud and generally not packed to the point where you can't easily move around. I like the place."

author: Eric Bogard
text: 'Best bar in town: awesome taps that constantly are rotated
column5: meat market free
column6: and unpretentious.  Bonus points for being across the street from Sri Thai.'

author: Matt Evangelisti
text: "I was surprised to see bad reviews! I went here last night for the first time and met the owner. He's very friendly and you can tell he cares about his business/customers. He puts a lot of effort into running events
column5: specials
column6: and keeping ‚Ä¶"

author: Randallius *
text: "This place is just plain awful. The beer was flat
column5: the only patrons were fat
column6: old guys
column7: and the whole place stunk like a public bathroom. Oh
column8: and the bar owner seemed to be flamboyantly gay
column9: which was weird. You couldn't pay me to enter this establishment again."
